meta.name: description
meta.content: The Potsdam Central School District is located in the village of Potsdam, New York, a rural community in St. Lawrence County and serves students.

div.style: color: #fff; background: rgba(0,0,0,.5); display: block; position: absolute; z-index: 99; padding: 1em; box-sizing: border-box;top: auto; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 1850px; height: auto

div.div: To inspire, prepare, and empower our students to lead fulfilled lives as compassionate, productive and engaged citizens.

This message is to inform you of updated food pick up days. For the week of March 23rd, Potsdam Central School will have food available for pick up on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday and Friday. Beginning Monday March 30th Potsdam Central School will have food available for pick up on Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
Food pick is available for all children 18 and under. This program is not based on your income. One family member should be there to pick up food. Children are not required to be present.

Due to the State of Emergency declared by the St. Lawrence County Board of Directors, and in consultation with St. Lawrence County and St. Lawrence Public Health, the St. Lawrence-Lewis BOCES and its 18 school districts have made a unanimous decision to close school immediately until at least April 20th. The districts, in collaboration with Public Health, will reevaluate the return of staff and students prior to the 20th to determine whether or not it is safe to return.

Due to the State of Emergency declared by the St. Lawrence County Board of Directors, and in consultation with St. Lawrence County and St. Lawrence Public Health, the St. Lawrence-Lewis BOCES and its 18 school districts have made a unanimous decision to close school immediately until at least April 20th. The districts, in collaboration with Public Health, will reevaluate the return of staff and students prior to the 20th to determine whether or not it is safe to return.
